bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. HARTZLER:H.R. 2136.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I: Section 8: Clause 3 The United States Congressshall have power``To regulate Commerce with foreign Nations, and among theseveral States, and with the Indian Tribes.''[Page H2956]

item.name: General Farm Commodities, Risk Management, and Credit Subcommittee
General Farm Commodities, Risk Management, and Credit Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on General Farm Commodities and Risk Management.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

summary.text: Small Business Credit Availability Act - Amends the Commodity Exchange Act (CEA) to exclude from the meaning of financial entity any small bank, savings association, farm credit system institution, non-profit cooperative lender controlled by electric cooperatives, or credit union if the aggregate uncollateralized outward exposure plus aggregate potential outward exposure of the entity with respect to its swaps does not exceed $1 billion. (Thus exempts such entities from the clearing requirement.)

bill.title: Small Business Credit Availability Act

item.title: To ensure small businesses in rural America have access to credit to promote economic growth and job creation, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on General Farm Commodities and Risk Management.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
